result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Bishop

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Bishop in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bobot was appointed but was not aware. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CORRECTION regarding the 8-29-22 entry: Attorney Michael Plaisted was NOT available to accept an appointment. Attorney Vincent Bobot was appointed as counsel on 8-30-2022. Signed order and complaint were sent to Defense on 8-31-2022. Same conditions as the 8-29-2022 hearing apply.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Brandon Bishop in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Plaisted  to represent defendant  at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Defendant repay the County at a rate of $20.00 per month. Repayment to begin November 1st, 2022. DEFENDANT TO MAKE PAYMENTS TWICE A MONTH.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon Bishop in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge RESERVE, Branch 13. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon Bishop not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 8/3/2022.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Bishop
Current: 3806 N 41st Street, Milwaukee, WI   (Effective: 07-21-2022)
Prior: 9244 North 53rd street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Brandon Bishop not in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 2:30p
